# About Kings Neuro Consultants

Kings Neuro Consultants brings together specialist neurological care and advanced neuroscience research to provide patients and families with clear, evidence-based insight into neurological health. Our approach combines clinical excellence, scientific rigour, and accessible communication to ensure patients feel informed, supported, and confident in their care.

### Dr. Hatice King  
**Consultant Neurologist – Cork**

Dr. Hatice King graduated with distinction from Istanbul University and completed specialist neurology training in 2018. She was awarded a research fellowship by the European Academy of Neurology, conducted research at the University of Edinburgh, and has held senior clinical roles in UK-wide motor neuron disease trials.

<p class="expertise-title">Her clinical expertise includes:</p>
<ul class="expertise-list">
- **Multiple sclerosis (MS)**  
- **Headache disorders and migraine**  
- **Transient ischaemic attack (TIA)**  
- **Epilepsy**  
- **Stroke**  
- **Functional neurological disorder (FND)**  
- **General neurology**

### Dr. Declan King  
**Neuroscience Researcher & Consultant**  

Dr. Declan King spent most of his 20+ years at the University of Edinburgh, conducting neuroscience research primarily using post-mortem tissue. During this time, he collaborated internationally with major pharmaceutical companies, the National Institutes of Health (NIH), and the Foundation for the NIH (FNIH).

His research highlights include:  

- Establishing **SV2A PET imaging as a biomarker of synaptic density in Alzheimer’s disease**, supporting its use in disease-modifying clinical trials.  
- Investigating **synaptic resilience in ageing and neurodegenerative disease**, exploring how synaptic structure and molecular composition contribute to healthy cognitive ageing.  
- With **27 peer-reviewed publications** in neuroscience and neurodegeneration.

Dr. Declan King provides **consultancy services related to neuroscience research, biomarker development, and healthy ageing studies**. He does not provide medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment.
